page.title: 01Watercress Valleys
page.content: Mainly chalk. Two valleys Tributarys of the Alre with watercress beds grass and arable land between and east rising to 120m, divided by hedges copses. A large wood in SE called Sutton Beech an ancient wood. Plantations Whites and Bowers grove. Area intensley farmed, Wheat, Barley Watercress, Dairy cattle Sheep and beef. Agriculture is the main employers others are Mid Hants railway, Computor factory, garages and builders. Communitys- Bighton, old and new dwellings,farmhouses,cottages and bungalows. Owner occupied, rented and tied, church,pub, shop, and village hall well used. Bishops Sutton mainly pre 20th century dwellings and church similar to Bighton.
